answers.answer: Hello,These symptoms can be due to hypothyroidism. Symptoms of hypothyroidism are fatigue, depression, weight gain, cold intolerance, dry, coarse hair and skin, constipation,muscle cramps,decreased concentration, vague aches and pains, menstrual disorders,palpitation and swelling of the legs.I feel that you should consult a physician and get yourself and your thyroid hormone levels evaluated.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: I'm a sixteen years old swimmer with no previous major health issues, but I want to make sure before talking to my mom.  For the last month or so I've been feeling exhausted, constantly hungry, moody, slow to respond, and a bit lethargic.  I constantly get nicks in my fingers but lately they've been healing very slowly.  I'm constantly thirsty and have to pee often,  yesterday it bumped up to every half hour.  When I sleep I'm completely out and because it's break no one wakes me up so I'm dragging myself upstairs around noon, which is way abnormal for me because my body used to always wake me up around 10-10:30 regardless of how late I was up.  For the last week I've had a terrible headache that refuses to go away.  I've always had headaches, but never like this.  I haven't lost weight as far as I can tell, but can that be from swimming?  I shake a lot and have had a few emotional break downs.Everyone I try taking to blames it on my period, being new to swimming (even though it's been four months), lack of sleep, stress, or end of the year depression (which I've struggle with before), but this doesn't feel like any of those.  It just doesn't feel natural and it's beginning to scare me but I don't want to seriously approach my mom if its just me over-dramatizing.
title: Do I have Type 1 Diabetes?
